verses.verse: How shall we sing the LORD’s song In a foreign land?
If I forget you, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand forget its skill!
If I do not remember you, Let my (Ps. 79:1) tongue cling to the roof of my mouth— If I do not exalt Jerusalem Above my chief joy.
Remember, O LORD, against (Job 29:10; Ps. 22:15; Ezek. 3:26) the sons of Edom The day of Jerusalem, Who said, “Raze it, raze it, To its very foundation!”
O daughter of Babylon, (Jer. 49:7-22; Lam. 4:21; Ezek. 25:12-14; 35:2; Amos 1:11; Obad. 10-14) who are to be destroyed, Happy the one (Is. 13:1-6; 47:1) who repays you as you have served us!
Happy the one who takes and (Jer. 50:15; Rev. 18:6) dashes Your little ones against the rock!
(The LORD’s Goodness to the Faithful) A Psalm of David. [1] I will praise You with my whole heart; (2 Kin. 8:12; Is. 13:16; Hos. 13:16; Nah. 3:10) Before the gods I will sing praises to You.
(Ps. 119:46) I will worship (Ps. 28:2) toward Your holy temple, And praise Your name For Your lovingkindness and Your truth; For You have (1 Kin. 8:29) magnified Your word above all Your name.
In the day when I cried out, You answered me, And made me bold with strength in my soul.
(Is. 42:21) All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O LORD, When they hear the words of Your mouth.
Yes, they shall sing of the ways of the LORD, For great is the glory of the LORD.
(Ps. 102:15) Though the LORD is on high, Yet ((Ps. 113:4-7)) He regards the lowly; But the proud He knows from afar.

(Prov. 3:34; (Is. 57:15); Luke 1:48; (James 4:6; 1 Pet. 5:5)) Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me; You will stretch out Your hand Against the wrath of my enemies, And Your right hand will save me.
((Ps. 23:3, 4)) The LORD will perfect that which concerns me; Your mercy, O LORD, endures forever; (Ps. 57:2; (Phil. 1:6)) Do not forsake the works of Your hands.
(God’s Perfect Knowledge of Man) For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. [1] O LORD, (Job 10:3, 8) You have searched me and known me.
(Ps. 17:3; Jer. 12:3) You know my sitting down and my rising up; You (2 Kin. 19:27) understand my thought afar off.
(Is. 66:18; Matt. 9:4) You comprehend my path and my lying down, And are acquainted with all my ways.
For there is not a word on my tongue, But behold, O LORD, (Job 14:16; 31:4) You know it altogether.
You have hedged me behind and before, And laid Your hand upon me.
((Heb. 4:13)) Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; It is high, I cannot attain it.
(Job 42:3; Ps. 40:5) Where can I go from Your Spirit? Or where can I flee from Your presence?
((Jer. 23:24; Amos 9:2-4)) If I ascend into heaven, You are there; ((Amos 9:2-4)) If I make my bed in hell, behold, You are there.
If I take the wings of the morning, And dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
Even there Your hand shall lead me, And Your right hand shall hold me.
